Serialized Form

  • Package account

    • Class account.Account extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialization Methods

        • readObject

          private void readObject(java.io.ObjectInputStream ois)
                 throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                        java.io.IOException
          Used to deserialize an Account object to estore the account's information after the ATM is rebooted.
          Throws:
          java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class of the serialized object could not be found
          java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

        • writeObject

          private void writeObject(java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
                  throws java.io.IOException
          Used to serialize an Account object.
          Throws:
          java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs.

        • readObjectNoData

          private void readObjectNoData()
                       throws java.io.ObjectStreamException
          Used in serialization when class inheritance is not as expected*
          Throws:
          java.io.ObjectStreamException - when an attempt to deserialize a back-reference fails

      • Serialized Fields

        • type

          java.lang.String type
          The account type (i.e chequing, saving, credit card, loc, and stock).

        • accountNum

          int accountNum
          The unique account number.

        • balance

          double balance
          The dollar balance on the account.

        • listOfTransactions

          java.util.ArrayList<E> listOfTransactions
          A list of Transaction objects representing transactions performed through the account. Deposits are not recorded in this list because they cannot be undone

        • dateCreated

          java.util.Calendar dateCreated
          The date the account was created.

        • atm

          ATM atm
          An instance of the ATM objectATM.

        • isJoint

          boolean isJoint
          Is true if the account is shared by 2 users and false if it has a sole owner.

        • readAndWrite

          ReadAndWrite readAndWrite
          An instance of the ReadAndWrite class

    • Class account.Asset extends Account implements Serializable

    • Class account.Chequing extends Asset implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • primaryStatus

          boolean primaryStatus
          Represents a boolean that is true if this account is the user's primary chequing account.

    • Class account.CreditCard extends Debt implements Serializable

    • Class account.Debt extends Account implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • creditLimit

          double creditLimit
          The maximum credit limit available for the user to spend per credit card account.

    • Class account.LOC extends Debt implements Serializable

    • Class account.Savings extends Asset implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • interestRate

          double interestRate
          The monthly interest rate applied to the balance in the savings account at the end of each month.

    • Class account.StockAccount extends Asset implements Serializable

  • Package atm

    • Class atm.ATM extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialization Methods

        • readObject

          private void readObject(java.io.ObjectInputStream ois)
                 throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                        java.io.IOException
          Used in serialization to restore the ATM's state after it reboots.
          Throws:
          java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class of the serialized object could not be found
          java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

        • writeObject

          private void writeObject(java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
                  throws java.io.IOException
          Used to serialize the ATM object.
          Throws:
          java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs.

        • readObjectNoData

          private void readObjectNoData()
                       throws java.io.ObjectStreamException
          Used in serialization when class inheritance is not as expected*
          Throws:
          java.io.ObjectStreamException - when an attempt to deserialize a back-reference fails.

      • Serialized Fields

        • bills

          Bills bills
          Stores the total amount of the bills in the ATM in an array with the following order: [5 dollar bills, 10, dollar bills, 20 dollar bills, 50 dollar bills].

        • listOfUsers

          java.util.ArrayList<E> listOfUsers
          The list of all users who can use the ATM.

        • BM

          BankManager BM
          The Bank Manager.

        • date

          java.util.Calendar date
          Today's date.

        • interfaces

          Interface interfaces
          ATM's interface displayed to users.

        • broker

          Broker broker
          The Broker responsible for investments.

        • subscriptions

          AvailableSubscriptions subscriptions
          All available services users can currently subscribe to through the ATM.

        • subscriber

          Subscriber subscriber
          Handles subscriptions for users.

      • Serialized Fields

        • type

          java.lang.String type
          Type of transaction (i.e Transfer In/Out, Deposit, etc.)

        • accountNum

          int accountNum
          The number of the account used to perform the transaction.

        • amount

          double amount
          The dollar amount of the transaction.

        • billPayee

          java.lang.String billPayee
          The name of the external account to whom a bill is being paid to.

        • mutualFundsPortfolio

          java.util.HashMap<K,V> mutualFundsPortfolio
          A hash map that stores the mutual fund the user has invested in as a key and stores an array list containing two values: [amount user invested in the mutual fund, the percentage of the fund the user owns through this investment].

        • readObjectNoData

          private void readObjectNoData()
                       throws java.io.ObjectStreamException
          Reads an object with no data stored in it.
          Throws:
          java.io.ObjectStreamException - when an attempt to deserialize a back-reference fails

      • Serialized Fields

        • risk

          int risk
          The risk level of the mutual fund: 1 is low risk, 2 is medium risk and 3 is a high risk fund

        • name

          java.lang.String name
          The name of the mutual fund

        • stocks

          java.util.ArrayList<E> stocks
          The stocks in that are in this mutual fund

        • investors

          java.util.HashMap<K,V> investors
          A hash map of users that have invested into this fund as keys and an array list of doubles in the following format: {amount user invested, percentage of the fund the user owns through this investment}
